edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit

Class GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit.GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GarbledBooleanCircuit, GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended

    public class GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp
extends java.lang.Object
implements GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
    This class is an implementation of an extended garbled boolean circuit.

    The extensions implemented in this class are:

    1. The ability to set the input or/and output garbled values.

    2. The ability to sample the garbled values using a given seed.

    1.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

        public GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp(GarbledBooleanCircuit gbc,
                                MultiKeyEncryptionScheme mes)
        This constructor should be used in case the garbling is done using a MultiKeyEncryptionScheme.

        It gets the inner garbled boolean circuit and the encryption scheme.

        Parameters:
        gbc - The inner garbled boolean circuit to wrap.
        mes - The MultiKeyEncryptionScheme to use during garbling.

      • GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

        public GarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp(GarbledBooleanCircuit gbc,
                                MultiKeyEncryptionScheme mes,
                                PseudorandomGenerator prg)
        This constructor should be used in case the garbling is done using a PRG and seed.

        It gets the inner garbled boolean circuit, the encryption scheme and the PRG.

        Parameters:
        gbc - The inner GarbledBooleanCircuit to wrap.
        mes - The MultiKeyEncryptionScheme to use during garbling.
        prg - The PseudorandomGenerator to use during the garbling process.

        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Gets the input keys, which are the input garbled values and sets them. This way when calling the garble function the input values will not be sampled but taken from the given values.
        Specified by:
        setInputKeys in interface GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        inputValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire.

        public CircuitCreationValues garble(byte[] seed)

        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit

        This method then performs the lookup on the accompanying allInputWireValues Map and sets the inputs to the corresponding garbled outputs.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        ungarbledInput - A map containing the GarbledWire indices and non garbled value for that index.

      • setInputs

        public void setInputs(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> presetInputWires)
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        This method sets the input of the circuit.

        It takes as a parameter a Map that maps the input wire indices to a garbled wire containing the appropriate garbled values.

        See GarbledBooleanCircuit.setGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput(Map, Map) for an alternate way of setting the input.

        Specified by:
        setInputs in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        presetInputWires - A Map containing the input wires that have been preset with their values.

      • compute

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> compute()
                                                         throws NotAllInputsSetException
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        This method computes the circuit if the input has been set.

        It returns a HashMap containing the garbled output. This output can be translated via the GarbledBooleanCircuit.translate(Map) method.

        Specified by:
        compute in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        returns a HashMap that maps the index of the output wire to the garbled value of the wire.
        Throws:
        NotAllInputsSetException - if not all the input has been set.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - A map containing both keys for each input wire. For each input wire , the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        This verify function is the same as the verify(Map allInputWireValues) but also check that the resulted output garbled values are equal to the given allOutputWireValues.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - A Map containing both keys for each input wire. For each input wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        allOutputWireValues - A Map containing both keys for each output wire. The generated output garbled values are checked against these values to see if they are equal. For each output wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • internalVerify

        public boolean internalVerify(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        This function behaves exactly as the verify(Map allInputWireValues) method except the last part. The verify function verifies that the translation table matches the resulted output garbled values, while this function does not check it but return the resulted output garbled values.
        Specified by:
        internalVerify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - A map containing both keys for each input wire. For each input wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        allOutputWireValues - A map containing both keys for each output wire. When calling the function this map should be empty and will be filled during the process of the function.
        Returns:
        true if the garbled table of this circuit is complied with the given input keys, false otherwise.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] seed,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputGarbledValues,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputGarbledValues,
             CryptographicHash hash,
             byte[] hashedCircuit)
               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        This verify function samples the keys using the given seed, then compute the hash function on the circuit's garbled tables and translation table and check that the result is equal to the given hashedCircuit.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        seed - to use in order to generate the keys.
        allInputGarbledValues - A map containing both keys for each input wire. Should be null in case the user set no input garbled values before garbling.
        allOutputGarbledValues - A map containing both keys for each output wire. Should be null in case the user set no output garbled values before garbling.
        hash - CryptographicHash object to use.
        hashedCircuit - A byte array that suppose to be the result of the hash function on the circuit.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended is a garbling the given seed, false if it is not.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        hash - CryptographicHash function object to use.
        hashedCircuit - A byte array that suppose to be the result of the hash function on the circuit.
        Returns:
        true if the given hashedCircuit is indeed the result of the hash function of the circuit; False, otherwise.

        Parameters:
        garbledOutput - A Map that contains the garbled output. This map maps the output wire indices to GarbledWires
        Returns:

      • getGarbledTables

        public GarbledTablesHolder getGarbledTables()
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        The garbled tables are stored in the circuit for all the gates. This method returns the garbled tables.

        This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

        This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

        Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

        Specified by:
        getGarbledTables in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit

      • setGarbledTables

        public void setGarbledTables(GarbledTablesHolder garbledTables)
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Sets the garbled tables of this circuit.

        This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

        This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

        Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

        The receiver of the circuits will set the garbled tables for the relevant circuit.

        Specified by:
        setGarbledTables in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit

        public int[] getOutputWireIndices()
        Specified by:

      • verifiedTranslate

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> verifiedTranslate(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> garbledOutput,
                                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allOutputWireValues)
                                                        throws CheatAttemptException
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Verifies that the given garbledOutput is valid values according to the given all OutputWireValues.

        Meaning, for each output wire, checks that the garbled wire is one of the two possibilities. Then, translates the garbled output obtained from the GarbledBooleanCircuit.compute() function into a meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

        Specified by:
        verifiedTranslate in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        garbledOutput - A map that contains the garbled output. This map maps the output wire s to GarbledWires
        allOutputWireValues - both values for each output wire.
        Returns:
        a Map that maps the output wire indices to ungarbled Wires that are set to either 0 or 1.
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if there is a garbledOutput values that is not one of the two possibilities.

      • getTranslationTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Byte> getTranslationTable()
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns the translation table of the circuit.

        This is necessary since the constructor of the circuit may want to pass the translation table to an other party.

        Usually, this will be used when the other party (not the constructor of the circuit) creates a circuit, sets the garbled tables and needs the translation table as well to complete the construction of the circuit.

        Specified by:
        getTranslationTable in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        the translation table of the circuit.

      • setTranslationTable

        public void setTranslationTable(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Byte> translationTable)
        Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Sets the translation table of the circuit.

        This is necessary when the garbled tables where set and we would like to compute the circuit later on.

        Specified by:
        setTranslationTable in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        translationTable - This value should match the garbled tables of the circuit.
